overview: This subject is an introduction to the principles and techniques of scriptwriting for the theatre. A selection of theatre scripts in various styles will be studied, in conjunction with relevant critical material, to enhance the production of an original script. Students will each view a current Melbourne theatre production and review the scriptwriting concept and techniques through blog-posts on a class forum, as well as participating in workshopping of their classmates’ scripts throughout semester. This subject is compulsory for students planning to take Writing Radical Performance in the 3rd year of their studies.

assessments.description: Attendance and participation: It is compulsory that each student presents a work-in-progress script. Attendance and participation is also expected in the workshopping of classmates' script. 250 words (equivalent)

An Interactive Essay (inc. interactive material such as images, audio, links etc) that critically
assesses the scriptwriting concept and techniques of a current performance work featured in the subject readings. A list of performances will be provided.. 1000 words (equivalent)
An introduction to the critical concepts and script techniques that underpin the final script, submitted with the script during the examination period. 250 words
An original script for performance. 2000 words

Hurdle requirement:. 1. Attendance hurdle requirement: This subject has a minimum requirement of 80% attendance at tutorials, seminars, or workshops. There is an expectation that students attend lectures.

Hurdle requirement:. 2. Late Penalty and Assessment hurdle requirement: Assessment submitted late without an approved extension will be penalised at five per cent (5%) of the possible marks available for the assessment task per day or part thereof. All pieces of assessment must be submitted to pass the subject. Each submitted assessment must be complete, constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task and will not be accepted after 20 University business days from the original assessment due date without written approval.

Semester 1.Contact hours: Total 30 hours: 2.5 hours per week comprising of a 1-hour lecture and a 1.5-hour tutorial for weeks 1-6 and a 2.5 hour workshop for weeks 7-12

Prescribed texts: Paul C. Castagno 2012 New Playwriting Strategies London & New York: Routledge
